newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila SEC orders Chemphil to hold meeting.
newsitem.headline: Manila SEC orders Chemphil to hold meeting.

text.p: The Philippines' Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has ordered Chemical Industries of the Philippines (Chemphil) to hold its stockholders' meeting in the next 30 days, SEC document released on Monday showed.

"The Commission hereby directs ... Chemical Industries of the Philippines Inc to call and give notice of the annual stockholders' meeting to be held 30 days from today in its principal office," the SEC order dated September 12 said.
The order came after minority stockholders, Ramon Garcia and Chemphil Export and Import Corp, complained that the present board had postponed the meeting for an undetermined date.
Under its by-laws, Chemphil's annual meeting should be held on the fourth Wednesday of May. The board postponed the meeting last May due to unavailability of the stockholders.

The minority stockholders, through lawyer Amado Santiago, said in a statement the postponement of the meeting "has resulted in the illegal extension of the term of office of the members of the Board of Directors and the deprivation of our clients' right and opportunity to ... represent and protect their interests".
Chemphil produces phosphates, surfactants, alkylates, sulphuric acid and other chemical products.
